website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay up for this option, but you'll be getting a top-quality camera with a wide range of impressive features.
pros: Cord is an improvement over past versions in terms of installation
High marks for its tracking and zooming features, as well as the two-way voice function
Audio and video software are unbeatable
cons: Some complaints about the night vision being marginal
Price tag is a bit steep

customer_reviews.title: After great deal of efforts by myself and working with Nest ...
customer_reviews.text: it advertised WiFi a/b/g/n/ 2.4 to 5.0 GHz compatible right on the box. After great deal of efforts by myself and working with Nest chat line, Nest finally admitted this product is not 5.0 compatible, It only works for 2.4 GHz, a very busy band to use. False advertising from Nest, shame on such a reputable company. Great disappointment for me. Return and refund this p[product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Useless as Security Camera with the most recent software update.
customer_reviews.text: With the recent software update, Google forces the status LED to be on at all times. At night this camera stands out in the darkness, actually alerting the potential intruder of its location and field of view. This blatant and intentional flaw makes my house actually less secure because potential intrude is made aware of camera's location and is able to bypass it. I called Nest and requested to return the camera for a refund, since the camera is now useless as a security device, and my request was denied. Google cares more about someone else's "privacy" than about the security of its paying customers. Will never purchase Nest or Google again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bil

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: Nest/Google Controls Features
customer_reviews.text: Buy at your own risk, Nest/Google can disable features and controls at will after you purchase. I have owned two of these cameras for over a year now. Google just notified users that the ability to turn the LED status indicator lights on or off will no longer be an option. They are forcing the lights to remain on despite the fact that customers purchased these devices specifically for their discreet capabilities. Extremely disappointed. A tiny piece of well-placed electrical tape may improve the performance of this new "feature" greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Nest you could be the best...
customer_reviews.text: This product could be so awesome but there is one big issue. Nest charges a pretty high $10 per month fee to use the camera with Theo functionality. You don't have to pay it but then you get a really dumb camera that is not worth the big price tag. Who is willing to pay another $120 a year per camera in order to use the product the way it should be used. I would never by nest cameras again
customer_reviews.author: Zimonomiz

customer_reviews.title: Annoying neglect in design
customer_reviews.text: A brief summary. The camera unit itself is well made and has crisp say and night resolution. The power cable is horrible- the camera end is not removable and the male end is 3/4 of an inch thick. I was planning on drilling a hole in the eave and hiding the cables in the attic but since the hole would be a massive to just fish he line through- i couldnt do that. Annoying neglect in design. My camera also kept going offline intermittently. Through problem solving I discovered that it doesnt do well on the 5ghz wifi. Switched to the 2.4 ghz wifi and it runs solid. Wouldnt have been easy for a non-techy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Righteousdude80

customer_reviews.title: Huge Upgrade for Arlo
customer_reviews.text: The Nest Cam Outdoor was an upgrade from my three year old Arlo, and in a big way. The quality of the video, and the speed at which I could pull up a live view isn't even close to being comparable. The added bonus is the speed and accuracy that Nest Aware is able to see motion, identify it as a person, or other moving object, and then pop up the notification on my Apple Watch! It was easy to set up. Super happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam P

customer_reviews.title: Good camera until the Google integration
customer_reviews.text: The Nest hardware works well. The cameras are reliable and give good image quality. They work well at night, but the range is adequate not stellar. The hardware is 5 star. The Nest app was very good until they merged with Google. Recording is expensive. Now some previously easy tasks are very complicated if you can do them at all. If the hardware wasn’t so expensive, I would replace all my nest cameras with someone’s else’s because of the Google integration. I give this part 0 stars. Overall I would not buy Nest again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Google overreach
customer_reviews.text: Of course, now that Google has purchased Nest, they are changing the options and integrations that Nest had prior to the acquisition. Google should not be able to decide whether or not the status light on my cameras are on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smith

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL Customer support !!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another camera for my home that was having intermittent Offline issues, so i contacted customer support. It is AWFUL !! First, there is zero USA support, its outsourced to Honduras and i believe Phillipines. The language barrier is ridiculous, and troubleshooting takes forever. I was on the phone for over an hour, speaking to several people, was on hold at one point for 17 minutes....its just ridiculous. I may return the camera just based on how AWFUL the customer support is. Absolutely the worst ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nest just sells stuff - lifetime maintenance is your problem
customer_reviews.text: The Nest engineers that designed these cameras had too little imagination. They weren’t designed to accommodate network changes. They had no pride in their work. Just putting crap together to make a sale. The ability to use another cable with the camera to change network settings would make them much more valuable. Install the cameras for easy removal in case your network changes. Don’t expect any help from Nest.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Dziuk

customer_reviews.title: WAY OVERRATED, failed experience!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is nice, but I can’t pair it with the cloud subscription that I purchased, TWICE! It useless without the subscription. I tried the support options, three times, wasted hours of my time, before finally one tech guy on the phone said he can see the problem, but needed a manager to fix it. So he “escalated” the problem to a manager, promising someone whould contact me with a solution within three days. This is day 5 now, no has called me. The worst case scenario of customer relationship: non-function product combined with HORRIBLE support!!!! This product, in my experience, is absolutely overrated, overpriced, and under-supported. Fail!!
customer_reviews.author: muaad

customer_reviews.title: Not now that Google Owns them
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nest cameras for security when Nest owned the company. They worked ok but now Google owns them and they decided to change the way that they operate without regard to the customers and their security. I have found a better product that is less than half the cost of these cameras. I will never buy a Google product or service.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan996

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Can You Turn Off The Status Lights!
customer_reviews.text: This product is no longer the quality product that I loved before Google bought Nest a few years ago. In August 2019, they announced (the same day of the changes) that they were taking away the ability to turn off the camera status lights "for greater transparency and privacy in your home". They should be turned off for outdoor security cameras in particular as this is like advertising to thieves and trespassers where your cameras are to avoid or steal them. Nest Aware alerts of activity in the camera area have taken longer and longer to the extent that they are now taking as long as seven minutes to receive on your cell phone. I no longer recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. File

customer_reviews.title: The streaming service is HORRIBLE. The camera is about 10 ft away from ...
customer_reviews.text: The streaming service is HORRIBLE. The camera is about 10 ft away from the router... no matter where I am (work, school, home) it takes forever to stream the video, very choppy and never stable (cut's out after a few minutes to "load" again). Stay away until they can fix their streaming speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Caboose

customer_reviews.title: Does not detect activity/motion most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: No detection of obvious things like garbage truck, person walking, car passing. The camera picks up the activity, but there's no tick mark on the timeline, so you have to painstakingly go through the whole history to see what has gone on. It's bad. Support was no good at all on this. I see that other people have the same trouble. Bought it in 2018, and the problem is getting worse as time goes by. I'll not renew 'Nest Aware' when current term ends. I'll just trash this unit and find something else.
customer_reviews.author: NVW

customer_reviews.title: changing my rating as nest team has butchered the product
customer_reviews.text: you can no longer disable the status light. seriously WTF? one of the main reasons i purchased this product was the ability to control the product, including disabling the status light. it is bad security practice to show your defenses. having a status light on shows your defenses and can lead to someone working around the camera, breaking it, disabling it, stealing it, etc. google has ruined nest.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: So here's my take after a year+ using these. I like the cameras, hate the subscription service. Just got some wyze cameras and they do the exact same thing for $0 monthly. For $25 for wyze versus $200+ for nest, absolutely can't justify or recommend these to anyone. Probably depends on your needs and these are outside cameras versus the wyze inside cameras. Overall, I'll be getting rid of these and finding another solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ataritron

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: You Cannot Return These if Defective!
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed it, plugged it in, and nothing. It didn't work at all. No lights, no picture, nothing. I boxed it up and returned it. Little did I know, YOU CAN'T RETURN THESE! Amazon received it, 3 different representatives confirmed this and assured me I would be refunded, but nothing. Nada. I spoke to a 4th representative, who helpfully informed me I would not be getting refunded. This is unbelievable. To be clear, Amazon does not let you know this is not returnable, so that's why I'm leaving this review. I would've never bought it - or any electronic, for that matter - had I know they wouldn't let me return it if defective. What a scam.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Costs even more to see footage and you can't talk to people with android.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this a 2-star review because you cannot talk to people very easily on a Android or Samsung phone. AND They still haven't fixed the app to where you can talk to and hear the people outside. In order to see all the footage 24/7 for the past 10 days you need to pay a $150 a year subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanical King

customer_reviews.title: The good: *I actually like and trust the magnetic mount
customer_reviews.text: The good: *I actually like and trust the magnetic mount. I was not sold on that initially but it actually does a great job and allows for more range of motion for initial placement than most fixed mounts. *Picture quality is good to excellent. *Night Vision is pretty great for seeing out to almost 130 feet from my front door into my yard. *Mounting hardware is quality products. The disappointing: The cabling. It has an enormous plug that has to plug into a hockey puck sized power source. I would have expected this from others, but from former apple engineers? Hell nah.
customer_reviews.author: Keyser Soze

customer_reviews.title: Service
customer_reviews.text: had the cameras for a few months and have had trouble with only one of them being offline more than it should be. when i contacted support they had me go through several test to try and determine the problem they felt it was my wifi causing the problem which I found strange as the camera is closer to the wifi signal than over half of the devices on wifi in my house. after going through about 45 minutes of the test they wanted me to do i got frustrated and asked them to send me a new camera. they did not respond so i hung up very frustrating to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Foot 74

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cameras 2 years ago. Google has recently decided that my security cameras MUST have a light on at all times to warn would criminals that they are being recorded. Because a criminal's right to to privacy is more important than MY safety. THIS IS NOT OK. If I had not been able to turn off the light, I would not have purchased the cameras. DO NOT BUY THEM!!!! There are plenty of other alternatives available.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in first 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed one of these in my driveway after a neighbor was robbed. Less than 3 weeks later, my garage and cars were robbed and I caught it all on my Nest camera. It wasn't clear enough to identify the culprits, but I was able to make out the vehicle and submit it to the police. Also within that first 3 weeks, I caught a USPS delivery driver throw a package instead of gently setting it down. I also caught a man letting his dog poop on our lawn. Prior to this, I thought I lived in a good, safe place. Glad I have this, and I will be installing more soon.
customer_reviews.author: G-Lanz

customer_reviews.title: best system ever
customer_reviews.text: we have 5 of these cameras and the a doorbell and we couldn't be happier. Everything is highly customizable, easy to install and configure, resistant and pleasant to look at. The camera captured a delivery guy backing into our mailbox, the doorbell prevented a flooding while we were on vacation on the other side of the world...so we love these products and the monitoring software that comes with them. You have to pay a little extra to keep a history of the events but it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Work just OK, when they work
customer_reviews.text: These cameras are ok when they work. Constantly drop offline (and yes, I followed all the possible fixes and, my wi fi is fine), see shadows as motion, see people as vehicles and vice versa, at times do not recognize movement or people as an event even though I see them go by with my own eyes, all of the IR lights do not appear to work, range is not even close to advertised. I can understand a couple of these things occuring occasionally but, they all occur frequently. For the price, these things should work much better than they do.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Nest Outdoor Camera clean install.
customer_reviews.text: Had mixed feelings about how this installed outside, with two different cords, USB followed by standard electrical plug in, with a cable just tacked to the wall. But I came up with a cleaner install using Legend Cordemate II wire channel, and drilling a hole at the eves of attached garage, to run the power cord through and plug it in inside the garage. Painted the wire channel to match trim and have a much cleaner more professional looking install. Camera works great, and the viewing and alert app is top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, it is now owned by google
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing after I bought this. The service, motion detection and quality went down hill considerably after google purchased it. I have notice considerable intermittent drops in live video, and literally watched vehicles and people walk within 40 ft of my camera and it never sent an alert. The phone app consistently crashes on my Xs max. And now the last update you the purchaser are not allowed to turn off the status light due to privacy issues which is a joke considering it is google who purchased it. My question is, since when has google been worried about everyone’s privacy?!!
customer_reviews.author: T Miller

customer_reviews.title: Has never worked right from day 1
customer_reviews.text: I've set up the zones on this thing 100 times in over 3 years and it never has worked correctly. It picks up any movement and shoots out an email 3500 times a day which basically makes the camera useless unless you just want to look and see what's happening at the moment. It picks up cars going up and down my road all day long 24/7 , and the road is waaaaaaaaay outside of the zone I have set up. I basically just have to choose no notifications at all or have the hundreds of notifications go to the spam folder. Either way, useless for home security if you want to be notified when the camera picks up something.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: GREAT if you're willing to pay yearly for NestAware, otherwise overpriced compared to competition
customer_reviews.text: Likely the best system on the market if you're willing to pay $100/yr for NestAware. The cost is understandable for the 10 days of continuous 1080p cloud storage, however, the other key features which make this system stand out from the others (person detection, zone detection), also require NestAware. One would expect that if you're paying a higher price for a better product, these two software upgrades should be included in the price and not require yearly fees.
customer_reviews.author: YSB

customer_reviews.title: No to MONTHLY/ANNUAL Subscription!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by other 3rd party sellers. They're cheap but it's all a scam. They shipped the item to a different address to look that they gave you a tracking number. Other than that, Nest Cam Outdoor is a great camera & good quality but the monthly/annual subscription of the Nest Aware just killed the product!
customer_reviews.author: TONibabes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works great.
customer_reviews.text: We are loving our new camera. We have had the indoor cameras but just added this one for outside. The ease of setup was even better than when we added the inside cameras. The only thing you need to consider is where you have outlets outside as far as placement options. As soon as it was activated I started receiving motion alerts on my Apple Watch and my husband on his iPhone. It’s great peace of mind to know what’s going on outside, especially when you’re not home. We are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for an easy to install outdoor camera that can be monitored from afar. I selected the Nest Outdoor camera as I'm a fan of the Nest thermostat; I figured this was the magic bullet. Installation was easy, however I didn't know that the entire housing wasn't magnetic and isn't a strong magnet. Therefore, I can't set the camera to the best angle, but its close. Today a bird landed on the camera and now I'm looking at the ground. The installation is 500 miles away and I have to look at the ground for the next 60 days until I get back to the property.
customer_reviews.author: David J Runt

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you want to be controlled for your own money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Bought 10 cameras and was very happy until they decided to do an update and take out an option of switching the security light off. “Sorry can’t get a refund because you bought your product on amazon and not from our store directly” “use a duct tape!” SERIOUSLY? A $200 camera and use duct tape? It’s like buying a 55” tv and get an update from samsung saying you can only watch 24” from now on. Give me my money back and update it as much as you want when I use it for free.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup for a Tech Dummy like me. Had up and running in less than an hour. Motion detection is good. Will subscribe to Nest Aware when 1 month trial is over as will be adding Nest indoor camera. Only negative I found is power cord is unwieldy and can’t really disconnect it to run wire for setup. Overall great camera with better night vision than my POE Vivotek cameras
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Item Arrived Without Outer Box
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived as promised, but was not shipped with an outer box, the shipping label applied directly onto the product plastic. Hopefully the electronics inside are not damaged. The corners are pretty beat up and some of the product plastic was torn (from shipping). I’m glad my building has a secure package room where the item was waiting for me, but not having the outer box just invites package thieves to walk off with some pretty expensive equipment. I will try to install the product and follow up this review after installation. Just disappointed in the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: jchugo

customer_reviews.title: Constantly off line
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Nest door bell camera about a year ago and it works great. I decided to get some more cameras to put around my house for added security. I went with Nest so I could have all cameras on the same app. I spent a day drilling holes into my house and crawling around my attic installing the cameras. Unfortunately, they constantly go off line. My router is very close to the cameras so signal isn’t a problem. I went into the app and made sure the cameras are constantly on, the problem still occurs. I am buying a new house and will instal Ring cameras. I do not recommend these cameras.
customer_reviews.author: SheShePTC

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor cam, but no replacement for a centralized DVR/NVR system.
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor nest security cam is a great solution for home security. It has crystal clear picture and the app is easy to work. Pairing it with the Wink hub allows for automation based on notifications the device sends. Like turning on the garage lights when it detects motion in certain zones. The only draw back is that there is a monthly charge to have saved recordings and for the zone options. Having many cameras this can add up pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: donalddavideTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: From the second you open the package you'll know they put love into this product. Mounts easy, seamless integration with an existing nest account, and it works great. Only complaint is sometimes it identifies people outside my zone, but usually works great. A little pricier than competitors but I think it was worth it. Costs around $5/month for cloud storage of 5 days of video, but a small price to pay for peace of mind. You won't regret buying one of these. Also it goes great with the Nest doorbell which we also purchased and love.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1080p I don’t see it.
customer_reviews.text: Ehhh...It’s alright. Claims to be 1080p but I don’t see it. Maybe if you don’t zoom in at all, but the picture can be choppy and you can’t read a license plate pass 20 feet. In the picture I feel like I should be able to read that license plate no problem. Update: So far the zones don’t work that great I get a ton of notifications for alerts outside my zones which is very annoying. Also I don’t always get a notification when someone pulls into or out of my driveway, kind of defeats the purpose. I’ll give the camera another week to see if it improves, if not I’ll be returning it and going with Arlo.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Google ruined the product
customer_reviews.text: Bought another Nest camera. Tried to add it to my Nest account that I prepaid for. Could not add the camera. Went to Nest support which forwarded me to Google. Google told me I had to talk to Nest. They sent me a link to Nest which forwarded me to Google. I told them what happened and they gave me a new link. When I tried to click on chat it said "Chat being cancelled" and then asked me to take a survey. When I tried to take the survey, it forwarded me to Google. lol. Mercy
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Riese

customer_reviews.title: Cameras have a major glitch that will not send motion notifications if it hears sound also.
customer_reviews.text: The cameras used to work great until it started having a glitch. I will not receive notifications for motion in activity zones or all other areas if my camera hears sound first. I have tried to explaining this to tech support but they don’t understand and this is getting very frustrating. So basically your camera can be a motion camera with the microphone off and it will send all the proper motion notifications.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: More than 1 or 2? Forget it
customer_reviews.text: Resolution leaves a lot to be desired on top of connection issues to Wi-Fi networks, unreliable access to footage and lack of features that need to be “unlocked” with additional reoccurring subscription. Not to mention you can only record with a paid subscription. If you need more than one or two cameras for your situation this is not what you want unless you enjoy headaches and reoccurring costs. Nest products are a solid skip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never again.
customer_reviews.text: Once Google took over this, it gets a ZERO, during the last four days I’ve spent over four hours on the phone with Nest and Google. Now I try to imagine standing on line at my local Walmart or Grocery store for FOUR hours trying to resolve a problem with a product that can’t function because their website isn’t working correctly. Promises made and unfulfilled. This is pure rubbish and bush league. I bought this system because it was Amazon’s Choice before they took a new direction. Left in the dust, Amazon you really let me down. My five hundred dollar investment is now nothing more than Fake Camera’s. The squeeze I’m feeling isn’t warm and comforting.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Earley

customer_reviews.title: High quality camera for a steep price
customer_reviews.text: There are other cheaper cameras out there that probably do the same thing as the Nest Outdoor Camera for cheaper but no one has the slick and easy to use interface that Nest is known for. It's so easy to bundle groups of cameras and other smart devices from the Nest line of products. The old adage is true, you get what you pay for and with this camera, you are paying for quality.
customer_reviews.author: E Summers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and work in all weather, day and night
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to identify what is best with security cameras, frankly just having one attached to the house dramatically reduces the likelihood someone will break in. But, if you're like me and you want it to be easy to setup and work efficiently - then these cameras are for you. Took less than an hour to have them up and running. I like that they plug into the wall, that way I don't have to fuss with batteries. Video and images are great. It notices a lot, so the alerts were something to get used to, but well worth it for the piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: JasonSM1

customer_reviews.title: works by subscription only
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know this until I opened the box and started setting it up, but it is impossible to review events that happened even seconds earlier without a subscription, and 3rd party applications are impossible unless you're willing to use a public URL. So if Google sells nest or changes their cloud services to force obsolescence of old products, then you will have nothing. Security cameras are supposed to be for piece of mind. How is that when you have to constantly watch the monitor so that you don't miss something that can't be reviewed, and if you did see something nefarious, you will have nothing to show the police or investigators. This product is a lie.
customer_reviews.author: Sydvicious_89

customer_reviews.title: Erratic Failure Security Camera
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but problems with the cameras. One camera had a night vision failure. Replaced it. Cameras kept losing wifi signal. Camera recorded a vehicle break in but didn't alert us. Bluetooth connection process is a bust. Don't install them where you can't reach the usb connector to hook it to your laptop. They look nice but are a disappointing product. We even installed wifi boosters within 10 feet of the cameras. Operation was still erratic. Too late to return them. I wish someone would steal them.
customer_reviews.author: Raynard C. Vinson

customer_reviews.title: Green Light constantly advertising camera locations now
customer_reviews.text: Used to love this, but the recent change that forces the green led light to be on while recording makes this visible on the outside now. I will not be buying another nest cam and I have the doorbell, this, and 3 indoor cams and buy the subscription. No more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Keep hoping this product will get better. I never does.
customer_reviews.text: It's very cumbersome to mount. I ended up having to build a stand out of wood to hold it. The bigger problem is Nest Aware. For as much AI capability as Google apparently has, this thing is constantly confused by the world. It freaks out at shadows and completely ignores people sometimes. We've been on the phone with support for weeks trying to figure out why it doesn't turn on and off when the app says it should. That's still unresolved. Still, it's one of the few cameras that doesn't have known backdoors in it. I wish it didn't suck.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Herz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cameras with lots of features, IF YOU PAY A YEARLY SUBSCRIPTION!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It does so many things you'd never think you need until you have it. The app is great. It notifies you when there's motion. It even knows the difference between a person and some other object. You can send clips of videos to people, etc. The nightvision works fine too. The big catch is that most of this functionality is on a trial basis. If you want to keep it you have to pay a yearly subscription fee. If you don't pay the fee you can only view the live camera feed and see still images of things that happened in the last 24 hours. Pretty f$%^ing lame if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Henry

customer_reviews.title: Very simple camera to set up. Good picture and detection
customer_reviews.text: First thing to note when it comes to Nest cameras is the need for "Nest Aware" if you want to use some of the premium features such as people detection. The pricing can vary but ultimately it's around $6 a month. With that aside, the camera is great for the price. The camera itself is pretty small and extremely easy to mount. The image is pretty wide and can cover just about the entire yard. The Nest app is clean and easy to use and seems to have a pretty strong/stable WIFI connection.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are great cameras, and the picture and sound quality are awesome. They disconnect from the wifi a lot. its quick and usually last a minute or 2 before it kicks back on, but that can be frustrating. I made the mistake of mounting one on the side of my garage under a flag. If a flag is anywhere in the view of the camera be prepared for constant notifications. I suggest also having a long cobweb broom to remove spider webs that inevitably will form. Spider webs moving in the wind and spiders set off the camera motion too. The last thing you want to see when opening a motion notification is a spider filling the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amber D

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device if you have an concerns about security. If your reading this you are getting packages from Amazon. This will allow you to see who’s at your door if your home or away with the app. With the ability to address anyone around the camera it could help scare off someone attempting to steal a package. Plus, you can install it high enough that someone won’t steal or damage the camera. Not taking a shot at Ring but currently people are prying them off doors, or walls. This works for me, but would assume there are other good cameras out there.
customer_reviews.author: M. Service

customer_reviews.title: Burglars Can Easily Spot Camera
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Google Nest has decided that the privacy of burglars is most important so they have decided to disable the ability to turn off the blinking green light on all cameras. Now, burglars can easily spot these cameras in the dark so they can avoid, cover, or disable them. Thanks Google for protecting the burglars!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Buy one for your peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. Probably the coolest thing I ever bought. Very customizable. One customizable feature I would have loved to know about before I installed it was you have the option to install it upside down and then rotate the image 180 degrees on the app, which allows the cord to come off the the top of the camera instead of the bottom. Super high quality images and sound. Very well made and very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: acmd1633

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment in Nest cameras
customer_reviews.text: the hardware itself is good, but the software is terrible. After having the cameras for a 12-20 months, purchased 4 cameras at different times. the cameras continually lose connection to wifi and I have tried numerous fixes (rebooting cameras, rebooting routers, using different wifi channels, and like). the cameras now go off line almost daily. I would suggest looking for a different brand, I will be looking myself to find a camera that is my dependable. these aren't cheap devices, so if need be I will buy cheaper cameras with the thinking of quantity since high end products dont last that long.
customer_reviews.author: PaulM

customer_reviews.title: Be aware that Nest cameras and Google Wifi don't necessarily play well together
customer_reviews.text: After I purchased a Nest thermostat I was all in with Nest hello, these outdoor cameras and then got the Google Wifi router/access points. Suddenly stuff stopped working - was told that there was an issue with my Home account ... some incompatibility with other Google products. Huh? Save yourself a ton of frustration and don't buy everything from Nest... it appears that Google is not really supporting their products as you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality camera, easy set up, but instructions, information, and customer support leave a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good. Set up is easy. Customer support is awful, sent in two questions and each took a week to respond, with the responses being worthless. Instructions on how to use (both camera and software) are almost nonexistent. Have to learn as you go. They say you need to subscribe to utilize 5 day + recording, which is understandable; but nowhere do they tell you that the camera is pretty much worthless without the subscription. Actually missed out on an issue when the trial subscription ended. Thought it would at least record a small amount, but it didn't - just a snapshot that was out of focus.
customer_reviews.author: Kz

customer_reviews.title: I'm not going to pay for the Google name and trust me nest support 50/50
customer_reviews.text: If you like paying into the home nest situation then fine but I think you can get better overall product by going with a hikvision camera and managing storage yourself. I inherited a nest doorbell and although I like it had I had my choice I would have gotten a hikvision I don't think nest offers a product with good customer support at all.
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Terrific camera, poor practicality for tidy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Camera works very well, fidelity is great and the connection through the App is excellent. Beware the install. The camera has two leads with plugs, one from the camera terminating in a USB that plugs into a converter box that then leads to a regular wall power plug. Unless your install measurements EXACTLY match these these two cable lengths then you have no options but to either coil unsightly cables on you wall or drill a large 7/8" hole through your walls and try to hide them inside.
customer_reviews.author: P Scott

customer_reviews.title: Speakers are not very loud and a little rain on the lens makes it useless till you clean in
customer_reviews.text: Expensive as hell and won't stay attached to the base under wind load. Speakers are not very loud and a little rain on the lens makes it useless till you clean in. Pros: Great picture quality day or night. Incredibly easy to install. Very easy to use. Cons: Weak magnet Lens is not Hydrophobic Monthly fees are very high No blue iris support If ring doorbell comes out with 1080p camera this size I'll switch.
customer_reviews.author: Coreburner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent outdoor WIFI cam with trial and tribulations
customer_reviews.text: Superior external WIFI camera, the second I’ve installed; though I wonder if it’s design engineers ever think of ways to make installation easier especially when trying retrofit to existing conditions. A Perfect example is the power cable with it’s 13/16” diameter plug that will not fit through an existing 3/4” diameter electrical conduit opening requiring drilling out the opening with a 7/8” masonry hammer drill bit on a ladder up about 20’. What a pain. A 15 minute job thereby ends up taking several hours.
customer_reviews.author: Grasbefore

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could keep an eye on my dog while at work. Gives me piece of mind when I can see he's doing just fine. I'll probably get the subscription to record and store video soon. Thinking about going with their doorbell next. Product arrived in perfect, new condition. No complaints except for how long it took to get the camera. Over 2 weeks! But can't blame them with this Covid 19 thing going on. I'd be confident ordering from DD US again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Brent Stamps

customer_reviews.title: Not enough hours of video footage available. to be called a security camera.
customer_reviews.text: In the end if you don't have a subscription, this is not much more than a nanny cam that you can check up on your house by. It really should have 12 hours of footage, not 4 to be useful. So basically if something happened overnight, without a subscription you wouldn't be able to see it. There has to be a better product. If they changed it to 12 hours, I would consider it a 4.5. With the subscription, it is pretty good for a business, but not as a stand-alone device.
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Dave

customer_reviews.title: Can't fix remotely
customer_reviews.text: My camera went offline, I called google to help me fix it remotely and you cannot. You must be near the device since it connects to your phone via bluetooth. If you plan to monitor your place remotely its not possible to trouble shoot it from afar, rendering the device useless.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: What more does this thing want from me? Wifi extender giving out 30mb dl speed and 10 upload. Everythings setup in the settings. I receive notifications of activity about 10% of the time. and sometimes you wont even get the event recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn off status light! You can spot this camera very easily in the dark.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to secure my property and for it to be inconspicuous. They have now disabled the status light so you can't turn it off! So now you can see my camera plain as day with the bright status light on. Very upset by this new update. I purchased a product that was able to be changed completely after purchase! Look for another option if you don't want your camera spotted. I will not be purchasing any more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Our camera stopped working after a few months. I tried everything to fix it. It powers on but turns off on its own. I tried calling customer support and it said 40 minute wait. I waited for 40 minutes and still never talked to anyone. I wish I could return it or get one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: These cameras look nice and are easy to set up but the system is total CRAP!! They do NOT work consistently. The camera has REPEATEDLY missed people coming and going from my property. I have 3 of these cameras and am looking to replace all three. Nest’s customer service is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Gill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, high quality
customer_reviews.text: I set these up in my back and front yards after a person broke into my back yard and wandered around my garage before leaving...having been broken into my home before, I hated that feeling, and back then affordable cameras with notifications via smart phones didn’t exist. I LOVE the Nest brand of indoor/outdoor cameras. They are high quality, the app is easy to use and program, and I am so glad to get notifications about movement and people coming to my house within seconds of them stepping foot on my property, whether we are home or not.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Alert Central
customer_reviews.text: If you don't pay for their monthly service, all you get is motion detection, not person detection, which seems to detect the wind blowing. I get about a dozen or more email alerts a day. The camera is pointed at my front door and walkway and doesn't cover the driveway or street. Whenever it goes off, there is a picture of nothing. No animal, no person, just my front door and walkway. I'd turn off alerts but what would be the point if someone really did show up that I wanted to know about? Not worth it unless you're planning on paying the $15 a month subscription fee.
customer_reviews.author: shadowgate100

customer_reviews.title: Useless.  Offline problems ALL of them have this problem
customer_reviews.text: Goes offline all the time randomly. I have put it next to the router and closer then my nest doorbell and it’s still goes offline 2month update: exchanged for another new camera. While new one was being shipped to me the first one power converter broke. As far as the newer one: same problem. Put it next to modem and still goes offline about ten times a day. The nest doorbell works great.... kinda
customer_reviews.author: mag

customer_reviews.title: Hate Google's Nest Aware Scams!
customer_reviews.text: I had the exact same experience as reviewer B. Gaston had. During the free 30-day Nest Aware Trial period, everything was great. No internet related issues, good alarm notifications, etc. Once the 30-day trial period ended, I've had constant errors..."Camera offline" "Weak internet signal".... Can someone say SCAM! This is my 2nd Nest Camera; 1st was purchased before Google bought out Nest and started scamming customers. Hate this camera!
customer_reviews.author: virgo gal

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but make sure you set it up indoors first and then use an extension cord to temporarily mount it in your expected location to make sure it is getting good WiFi coverage there before you work on running its cable. Otherwise it works fine and the magnet mount is strong and isn't affected by wind. Very well made and possibly the best packaging I've seen in a long time for DIY.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, affordable peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is the best security camera I have used. It is 1080p compared to most security companies 720p cameras. The app works well to notify when the camera spots movement. The picture is bright and crisp in both daylight and at night. Would recommend it to anyone considering a security system. Easy installation. The prices for the plans are also way more reasonable than other security companies.
customer_reviews.author: A. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Not So good: Unreliable and always going off line
customer_reviews.text: I have had these cameras for almost a year and have changed routers/modems several times but they both still kick off line at least tow times a week and stop recording. For the cost they should be more reliable and sensitive to modem signals but these are not. I would NOT buy Nest again. By the way their server's go down a an regular basis too. We We were trying to adjust the thermostat last week and it was off line due to server outage in all of LA and NY when I google why. Ridiculous. There guys are making too much money to be that unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Nezha Roide

customer_reviews.title: The NEST camera is an AWESOME addition to our home
customer_reviews.text: We've set 2 of these up. Tips: Don't even try to set it up remotely, it doesn't ever work. Just plug it into your PC and setup takes about 30 seconds. Then take it outside and mount it on the porch or house. It comes with a free 30 day trial to Nest to be able to watch past recordings, which we later subscribed to. It will ping my phone whenever it senses motion, which is nice when we're not home (to see a delivery driver, for instance). I love being able to check the house when we're away!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: B Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Feels well built. Image quality looks good but gets very distorted when zooming in. Volume level is poor when talking to someone through the app. You won't be able to make out a license plate after a distnce of about 20ft. Goes offline a LOT and for no apparent reason. Sometimes i need to unplug the camera, then plug it back to make it work again. Nest service has had outages where there is no way to connect. The app software is good. I'll look elsewhere for my next security camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the video is very poor. It was disappointing. Even in bright light you can see a lot of pixelation and in case you are wondering my internet connection is very fast. It also adds audio issues (very annoying) when playing back on ALL IOS devices. No fix as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cameras
customer_reviews.text: I got these as my first ever home cameras minus the nest hello. After installation these things are pretty great. I haven't had any issues to date so far. You do have to pay monthly/annually for the cloud storage called Nest Aware, I was aware of this before purchase so no surprise. They come with everything you need to install them minus if you are installing them too far from an electrical outlet. I had to add one in my attic for one of the cameras. Nightvision and day quality are pretty great also.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great cameras. Disappointed with zone feature.
customer_reviews.text: Generally, I’m happy with the cameras. Installation was pretty easy. However, I’m struggling to get the motion detection zones set. It is still picking up motion way outside the zones. I’m getting too many video clips and notifications from false detection such as cars passing, bushes moving in the breeze, and my flag moving in the breeze. I just figured out that you have to turn on the space is feature to see all your cameras at once. Love this feature now.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Good Cameras, little over-priced.
customer_reviews.text: I have three indoor Nest Cams, Nest thermostat, and two Nest Protects. Adding these two outdoor Nest Cams was as simple as expected. The cabling and housing are high quality and the picture comes through nice and crisp. One thing I wish Nest would do is either lowest the cost of the cameras in general or lower the cost for the est Aware subscription. Obviously this isn't a major barrier for me, but I could see others hesitate. All-in-all, I like the cameras which certainly beat having an expensive monthly security system. The biggest downside to using this as your primary security system is internet connectivity. Thankfully, my ISP provider is pretty reliable and we have nosey neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brendel

customer_reviews.title: Great at first - now won't detect motion
customer_reviews.text: The camera was great until about 6 months ago. After Nest was bought by Google, things have been the worst! I have motion zones defined, but it won't detect a person or car walking through the zones. Nest support has been terrible and hasn't been able to figure out why. Nest community bulletin boards are filled with examples of many others having the same problems! At this point I would not recommend and I am seriously considering getting a different camera
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Camera going off-line?  Problem solved.
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Nest camera for about 6 months and mostly love it. One big issue is camera would go off-line several times, every single day. Very annoying. We were using a rented Xfinity/Comcast router that was literally 20 ft away from the camera so I thought it had to be some kind of problem with the camera. Then, for other reasons, I replaced the Xfinity rented router with a Motorola MG7700 I purchased on Amazon. 3 weeks since I replaced the Xfinity router and the camera has not gone off-line once. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: AVOID ALL NEST CAMERAS UNTIL GOOGLE GETS THEIR ACT TOGETHER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a 24 Nest camera system for several years with good results until was recently encouraged to migrate to a Google account from the Nest Account. HUGE MISTAKE! They can not process a simple card correctly. They charged the card in full but GOOGLE Pay still thinks there is a problem with the card (any card) so I now have 4 cameras with zero recording and the inability to add NEST Aware recording to them. With my investment in the system I am stuck and this problem is 2 weeks running and ZERO customer service!!!! If you already are a Nest account holder DO NOT CONVERT OVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zarkoff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t pick up all motion
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the camera doesn’t pick up obvious types of motion. We’ve only had it up for a week or so, today was garbage day and it missed both the garbage truck and the recycling truck. Also missed us leaving the house for a walk with our dogs. Did some research to see there was a fix for the problem but found that others have had the same types of issues with with no success resolving it with Nest’s tech support people. Would give it 0 stars as a security device if that was an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best security camera I've purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you that if you are not savvy with networking then this is the camera for you. I've bought around 20 security cameras and this one is the top notch. Easy setup. Very good app with no known bug so far and the quality of the camera is great. No false alarm so far. And it looks good too. Many people complain about the subscription fees but I think it is reasonable. Otherwise you would have to manage the storage yourself and that is not very convenient (i.e. constantly removing old file and making sure that the storage is not full)
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, deceitful subscription cost.
customer_reviews.text: Knocked off two stars because of Nest lying about the subscription cost. Their site says $100 for the first camera, $50 for each other camera. Even though it does not say it on their site, they now claim this only applies to cameras at the same address. Even after calling they refused to honor the listed price. I was going to purchase at least two more cameras. I will now be looking at other brands. The camera is very easy to install and the video quality is great. The ability to create zones and have notifications is nice as I am able to exclude traffic in the street.
customer_reviews.author: KB-Boise

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this from the Ring unit (which btw was horrible). Why I chose to go for Nest over other units is for the simplicity of using it, the software, setup, and the fact that there's 2-way sound. Pros: Easy to set up - it comes with everything you need to install and mount the unit. The software is great, allowing you set up zones, alerts, and all that. The cloud service works wonderfully. Records 24/7 Reconnects on its own if disconnected and alerts you Cons: Night vision is not adequate and very difficult to see faces or anything with minimal light. Cloud service is more expensive than other services
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image quality, design, software and installation
customer_reviews.text: Image quality exceeds expectations. Build quality and installation hardware (high strength corrosion resistant screws for instance) is excellent with a clever, flexible magnetic design. The software is easy to use and intuitive and worked first time (if you're having issues, it's with your router configuration). The NestAware subscription (free for 30 days) is expensive at $100/year but has good features. I went for it but needs improvement. For instance, the scheduling feature only provides for camera on/off times. NEST should incorporate independent zones alerts into the software for separate notification of activity. For instance as a business owner, I'd like zone/notification for the parking area and for a gate entrance (shown in picture)
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Dube

customer_reviews.title: Nest should call this their OFFLINE camera.
customer_reviews.text: If you want your motion sensor to go bye bye on day 5 then buy this hunk of crap. If you want some non English speaking jerk to NOT help you, then buy this product. Typical crap. When will Americans sell and service products again? When they do, I'll pay 100% premium. How does NEST expect product to be beneficial when it constantly goes offline. Laptop and smartphone farther away from router and they are lightning quick. This thing is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Quite Usefull
customer_reviews.text: I only had mine up for about a couple of weeks when it captured my neighbor's truck being stolen around 2 AM. The only reason I don't rate five stars is that the grainy video of night video or when the foggy picture when there is much moisture. Be sure to adjust alerts if you place near any plants that are highly susceptible to a lot of movement because of wind. Otherwise your alerts will clutter your inbox.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Goose

customer_reviews.title: Misses significant moments
customer_reviews.text: This is my third camera and to be honest I use because I have the nest thermostat and having everything in one app is convenient. When it works it works well. However often it misses huge significant moments. Someone at the door, package drop off. If it wasn’t for the ability to scroll through the 25 hours I wouldn’t see things. Picks and chooses when this happens
customer_reviews.author: Sam Seligman

customer_reviews.title: Used to be better, fails in high temps
customer_reviews.text: This camera system was ok and had potential before Google bought Nest. Now it only works intermittently with lots of network failure time. Plus Google is pushy on requesting info and handling the camera data. Also, the cameras fail at temperature ranges over 94 degrees (actually kills the hardware!) so if you live where its hot be prepared to replace them after a few hot days.
customer_reviews.author: RyanC

customer_reviews.title: 5 and counting...
customer_reviews.text: This is our 5th Nest Outdoor camera (we have several indoor ones as well). We use it outside and inside for remote viewing and surveillance. The quality of the video is excellent and the app/website features and predictability is outstanding. Installation is easy and setup is a breeze. The power adapter is too large and I just use standard USB out small plug points for these to replace the bulk of the extra long cable. The only problem is that the cost of cloud recording. I have a massive amount of Google drive storage, but still have to pay a lot for the cloud recording. They should just merge the two.
customer_reviews.author: Ankur Jaiswal

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment.  Subscriptions way to pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality picture day and night. Motion activates with tree leaves swaying in wind, cars going by, moths at night. No way to record locally on personal DVR. Multiple cameras monthly subscriptions add up fast. I will probably keep the doorbell for now but the cameras go out at the end of my year subscription. I will not be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: JimC

customer_reviews.title: Camera went bad after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Cameras worked great I have 5 installed. One camera started showing a pink hue and I researched it and it was a Pixel issue. When I contacted Nest and Amazon, the warranty had expired. The other 4 are still working good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Yohe

customer_reviews.title: Two-way talk function useless
customer_reviews.text: The camera works fine for video but it is impossible to converse with anyone who comes to the door. There is almost a 10-second delay in voice communication. You press the talk button to talk and then release it to hear the response. But the person at the door doesn't hear what I said until almost 10-seconds later. If the person at the door manages to stay around that long and responds verbally, there is another long delay before I hear their response. Therefore, the two-way talk function is totally impractical and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M Berkelhammer

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE monthly subscription needed, rip off product. Better off with Wyze
customer_reviews.text: This product is a ripoff. Unless you sign up for the monthly subscription this camera is pretty much worthless. You will only get a notification if there is motion and you need to open the app to see it live. No recordings are stored only a screen shot of the past motion. This makes me not want to purchase the door cam or the thermostat by nest. NEVER ANOTHER NEST PRODUCT AGAIN. I purchased a $25 Wyze camera and it is 100 times better. I rather have 6 of those than one of this nest cam.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Sheng

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and Nest recording
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this camera and it's associated nest recording service. We have 4 cameras, they are easy to set up and work flawlessly. The AT&T wired internet that we have is quite slow ( 25mps down and 5mps up) but the cameras still work great. We're unable to upload at full bandwidth because of our internet but they perform extremely well at the "low" setting. We highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Trickle_down

product_meta.title: Google Nest Cam Outdoor 2-Pack - Weatherproof Outdoor Camera for Home Security - Surveillance Camera with Night Vision - Control with Your Phone
product_meta.description: Style:2 Pack Outdoor CameraNest Cam Outdoor is a wireless outdoor home security camera that helps you keep an eye on what matters from anywhere, rain or shine. Get an alert when there’s activity.[1] Talk and listen from your phone. It’s weatherproof and plugs into power. And with 24/7 surveillance, know about a break-in before it happens. [1] Some features, including mobile notifications, remote control, video streaming, and video recording, require working internet and Wi-Fi. [2] Includes all Nest cameras, speakers, and displays in the same home. [3] Chromecast Ultra requires a TV with an HDMI port, a Wi-Fi network, a Google Account, a nearby electrical outlet or USB port, and a compatible mobile device. Minimum OS requirements are available at g.co/cast/req. [4] Intelligent alerts require a Nest Aware subscription. Familiar face alerts not available on cameras used in Illinois. [5] This feature is only available with a paid subscription, and either sound detection enabled or at least one eligible camera. This feature is dependent upon network connectivity and other factors, and may not be available in all areas. Wireless devices may not be reliable for emergency communications. The 911 feature can connect you with the call center closest to the home address you provide during setup. [6] Only available with Nest Cams, Nest Hello video doorbell, and Nest Hub Max.
feature_bullets: Outdoor Wi-Fi camera 2-pack for home security with 24/7 live video
High definition surveillance camera with a 130 degree wide angle view, 1080p HD, and 8x zoom; night vision illuminates the whole scene, even when it’s dark outside
Looks for motion and sound activity and sends an alert to your phone or email[1]
Control your home security camera from anywhere with the app on your phone
Built in speaker and microphone lets you listen and talk back to visitors
Weatherproof and plugs into power so you don’t have to worry about dead batteries
Easy to install; just plug in the cable and adapter and mount the camera
Subscribe to the new Nest Aware for up to 60 days of event video history and new intelligent alerts[2]
Please refer to the product description section below for all applicable legal disclaimers denoted by the bracketed numbers in the preceding bullet points (e.g., [1], [2], etc.)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,664 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #2 in Complete Surveillance Systems#4 in Bullet Surveillance Cameras
